translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sīhāsanī
The Elder’s Birth Story about Giving a Lion Throne
“When the Lord of the World had attained Nibbāna,
when Siddhattha, the best of bipeds,
when the Pāvāna doctrine was widespread,

analyzed: bāhujaññamhi sa āsane  pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ
translated: in the dispensation of the Buddha Bāhuja,
with a mind full of confidence and joy,🔽I made a lion throne.
When the lion throne was raining down,
By that confidence in my mind,
I was reborn in the Tusita heaven.

analyzed: hatthi yānam assa yāna  dibba yānam upaṭṭhita
translated: Elephant vehicles, horse vehicles,🔽celestial vehicles were ready.

analyzed: nibbattanti yadicchaka  maṇi mayā ca pallaṅkā

translated: and many other couches made of heartwood,
this is the fruit of the lion throne.
and of crystal and lapis lazuli.
and this is the fruit of the footstool.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of that meritorious deed.
there were three people named Indra;
they were lords over the four continents.
and the eight liberations as well,
the six supernormal knowledges were realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sīhāsanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sīhāsanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has it been told by the Elder Sihasanapadayaka himself.
